name: The Michelangelo Hotel

reviews.text: I have FINALLY found a hotel I love in NYC. After staying at numerous other hotels in the area over the years, and after reading all the great reviews of the Michelangelo on this website, I decided to give it a try. The hotel staff is professional and very courteous, check-in was a snap and I too was upgraded to a great, huge room (an anomoly in NYC). Great view and the windows had heavy blinds which could be pulled down for deep sleep. Room service food was prompt and delicious. The bathroom was enormous and I really liked the toiletries offered. Quiet, relaxing room, nice turndown service and complimentary NYTimes every morning. Housekeeping attended to every need in a quick and efficient way. Lobby was classy with wonderful, live classical music every evening. Close to 5th avenue shopping, Radio City Music Hall, all the Broadway theatres. Overall, a first-rate hotel and a first-rate experience. I love this hotel. I have found my home away from home in NYC!
reviews.title: love it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Visited NYC for my birthday July 12-15, 2007. After reading all of the positive Tripadvisor reviews, decided to stay at the Michelangelo months ago and made reservations. We stayed in Room 737 (deluxe, king suite). Hotel graciously upgraded us for my birthday. The room was HUGE by city hotel standards. Every request (extra pillows, clean towels, room service) was instantly satisfied by the cordial staff. Early check-in was seamless. Many wonderful complimentary services (daily paper, turndown service with chocolates, shoe-shine, delivery of any "missing" toiletries, light breakfast each morning). My only negatives were that our room's A/C unit was rather noisy (ear plugs solved the problem for sleeping) and our room faced out on the street (city traffic noise all night long). An interior suite would probably have been quieter. Otherwise, the Michelangelo was exceptional. Lovely public areas (small lobby bar with nightly classical music). Perfect location. If you're looking for the perfect romantic getaway in NYC, try this hotel. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: A Gem in Manhattan

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in The Michelangelo for 5 nights and had a brilliant stay. Everyone was very efficient and friendly throughout our stay. We were upgraded to a studio room for free which was huge. The free coffee and little pastries were a nice touch and handy in the mornings although you wouldn't pay for them as the quality wasn't the greatest. We got amazing value for the size of the room and what we paid for it. I would definitely recommend this hotel as it's in a great location for sightseeing. I would stay there again on visiting New York.
reviews.title: Really lovely hotel, great location

reviews.text: We stayed at the michelangelo hotel in new york city for 4 nights in early july and it was fabulous. The location was amazing, the staff were very friendly and accomadating.
reviews.title: Our daughters deserve a pat on the back

reviews.text: When looking for a hotel we went through many different options that had rooms that were either far too small or absolutly hidious.( you know with the dark green carpet and floral print bedspreads)
reviews.title: FANTASTIC!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Michelangelo for a long weekend. It was an excellent choice. It is near theatres, restaurants, Rockefeller Center, and shopping.
reviews.title: great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a upgraded corner room which was very large and included a make-up counter and a walk in closet. The bath towels were the size of beach towels. There was a magnifying mirror that you could pull out. The curtains blacked out the lights from outside. No problem with street noise.
reviews.title: Super Hotel - Excellent location

reviews.text: The staff was very friendly and helpful. One day we asked for different pillows, and another day we asked for a hair dryer. Both times the item was brought to the room in 10 minutes.
reviews.title: Lovely and very civilised

likes.liked: — clean, comfortable big rooms well appointed
likes.disliked: — view wasnt great but that meant the room was at back of hotel and v quiet

reviews.text: The doormen were particularly nice, always talking with us as we went in or out. One day it was raining, and we asked the doorman for a place to buy an unbrella. He lent us a Michelangelo unbrella which we returned the next day.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: An interesting place to eat is Ellen's Starlight Diner on 51st and Broadway. The waiters and waitresses are aspiring Broadway cast members and they sing rock and roll and show tunes while you eat. A fun place for one of our lunches.
reviews.title: Elegant calm hotel

reviews.text: We just stayed here for our anniversary based on Trip Advisor reviews. It was lovely! Room was huge - we were upgraded to a king suite (I called to confirm non-smoking and mentioned the anniversary - never a bad idea!). The bathroom was gorgeous -- I loved it. We actually preferred this room to our room at The Mark which was 3 times the price. The only slight negative was that the breakfast buffet was very crowded when we went, but for the price (free!) it was good. We parked in their lot down the street (if driving on 51st it is BEFORE the hotel) and that was reasonable by NY standards. 2 subways are nearby, easy to get a cab. GREAT location. Amazing value! We will stay here again.
reviews.title: Loved the Michelangelo
Great
reviews.text: We stay there very often due to business. The hotel is great, quite, personable. The hotel does not have the busy feel of mega hotels. Service is excellent. Room size is pretty good for Manhattan.

Stayed here for five nights, April 26-May 1. Absolutely fabulous, beautiful furnishings and immaculate. The rooms were large and, I understand, huge by New York standards. The service was impeccable, friendly but not pushy. They served a nice complimentary pastry/coffee breakfast in the morning. The only complaint I can come up with about the place is the surly waiter tending to the breakfast. Just one, the others were nice. I saw this guy snap at a couple of guests on different occasions. But who cares, the place was nearly flawless.
reviews.title: Exquisite

reviews.text: I booked this hotel for a weeks to celebrate my Husband's 40th birthday, from the start the staff were very accomodating, we arrived early and our room wasn't ready, we only had to wait an hour and got an upgrade also.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.text: The room was spacious and comfortable and met all our expectations. True there is no safe in the room but boxes are available in reception with 24 hr access so it did not pose a problem.
reviews.title: Not Bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed in the Michelangelo for 3 nights in May '06 and we had a wonderful time. I have read some of the other reviews and picked the Michelangelo as a result of research done on this site. The reviews are correct, the hotel is clean and the rooms are spacious. I am writing this reivew in December so it has been some time since we were there. The hotel is in a perfect location especially if you are in town to see a Broadway show. It is within walking distance to Times Square, Madison Sq Garden, the subway and plenty of shopping. The staff was adaquate and the complimentary breakfast was nice (although we spent most mornings at Starbucks around the corner). I have posted some pics of our room enjoy!
reviews.title: Perfect Location! Beautiful NY Hotel!

reviews.text: Our family of four stayed at the Michaelangelo Nov 8-12, 2006. We very much enjoyed all aspects of the hotel. Service from front desk, concierge and bellmen was very professional and pleasant, the small lobby and bar area were very nice and we enjoyed the music during cocktail hour. Our junior suite on the 3rd floor was surprisingly quiet considering it faced 6th Avenue. We liked the room--well appointed and comfortable beds. Had a problem with the heating system first night but it was promptly fixed and didn't recur. Excellent location near (but not too near!) Times Square, Central Park and Rockefeller Center. We'd definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Loved the Michaelangelo
Best location in Manhattan
reviews.text: We stayed at the Michelangelo Hotel 10/27/06 - 11/1/06 and loved every minute of our stay. The location was the best in Manhattan - close to theater, shopping & many tourist sights, but off 7th Ave so the rooms are quiet. We were on the 3rd floor & seldom heard any traffic noise.
The room was well-sized and comfortable while the hotel lobby & lounge were beautiful and luxurious.
reviews.title: Fabulous Stay at the Michelangelo
Great Location
reviews.text: For the most part during our stay, the weather was warmer than we expected and we appreciated having full control of the air conditioner in the room. It was automatic, similar to central air conditioning units in our home in Texas, so it cycled on and off to maintain the desired temperature.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked a Saturday night stay at Quickbook.com for my wife and I for her birthday after reading many rave reviews about the Michelangelo. We got a great rate for NYC.
reviews.title: Fantastic stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you've ever been to Europe and stayed in a hotel in a major city there, that's what you can expect here. The lobby reminded me of a hotel we stayed at last year in Madrid. Very cozy, like a big living room.
reviews.title: Michelangelo, a great NYC value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived early on Saturday and hotel staff were happy to check us in and hold our bags until our room was ready and promised to deliver our bags to our room as soon as it was available.
reviews.title: Still a gem!
Our new NY favorite
reviews.text: We departed for lunch and returned around 3:30 PM; we picked up our room keys and were informed that we had been upgraded to a larger room. We went up to our room to find a huge-by-New-York-standards (and plenty adequate by anyone else's standards) corner room with 2 king sized beds and a large walk-in closet. Our bag wasn't there, and one phone call produced it in about 2 minutes, with a smile, a thank you and no obnoxious waiting around for a tip, the guy was gone before I even had a chance to offer one. Another phone call got 3 fiber pillows delivered to replace the feather pillows without aggrivation, and also in under 5 minutes. Finally, another phone call got us an iron and ironing board in under 5 minutes.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We returned after the theater to find our bed re-made, turned down and chocolates on the nightstand, along with a card with the next day's weather forecast. After a few drinks at the hotel bar, we found the Sunday Times waiting for us outside our door at around 1:30 AM.
reviews.title: Great location and concierge services

likes.disliked: — The rooms look different from the way they are pictured on the hotel's website, no upgrade

reviews.text: We stayed over the Easter Weekend (13th-19th April) and found The Michelangelo to be the perfect NYC base.
reviews.title: A comfortable and welcoming retreat
Loved This Hotel
reviews.text: Although very centrally and conveniently placed for many attractions, restaurants etc. walking through the entrance doors into the lobby was like embarking on a voyage on the sea of tranquility. The public areas exude an air of restrained luxury, coolness and restfulness.

reviews.title: great hotel
reviews.text: The front desk staff could not be faulted and the concierge James Jollis was a true gem even down to locating a dentist willing to perform his skills on Good Friday.
Oue suite was spacious, elegant and very accommodating with everything that one needs.
reviews.title: 2nd time around

reviews.text: At night the lobby and bar are filled with the airs of relaxing live piano music - an ideal precursor to an evening of gastronomic discovery nearby.
reviews.title: Wounderful
The best ever!!
reviews.text: We arrived at the hotel about an hour early for chekking in, but that was absolutely no problem!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And guess what... We were upgraded to a suite at no additional cost! Absolutely an overall amazing experience - We loved it!
reviews.title: Perfect for the right people

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And i can recommend this hotel to anyone who is going to stay at the best location in manhattan, no doubt.
reviews.title: Michelangelo Perfect Stay!

reviews.text: Everything (but breakfast) was wonderful, all staff were fantastic, room was perfect.
reviews.title: Excellent service, good rooms

likes.disliked: — Nothing really, bed a bit soft.

reviews.title: Excellent
reviews.text: Best value for travel-money ever.

reviews.title: Where were the Italians?
reviews.text: I was looking for the Italians who should have been staying at the hotel. The only indication was that some of the signage was in Italian. Oh well. When we stayed at the Sofitel last June, the hotel was very French (owned and operated) with most of the staff being able to talk to us in French. It was a nice touch.

The Michelangelo is in an excellent location - close enough to Time Square but even closer to Central Park. There is great shopping in luxury boutiques all around the hotel. We were able to walk to the two plays we had booked - Wicked and Producers - without any trouble. We walked to the Brasserie for supper one evening and took cabs to the other restaurants outside of the immediate area but, because it is so central, the cost was just a bit more than using the metro.
reviews.title: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay

reviews.text: The room was spotless, the sheets and towels were as promised - good quality. Staff were pleasant without being intrusive. I liked the decor even the tinkling of the crystal chandelier in the elevators. The hotel provides special coffees (hot and wonderful) and small sweet rolls in the AM (only between 7 and 9 and not a minute after)were fresh and tasty. We took a pass on the $6+ orange juice.
reviews.title: Excellent stay!

reviews.text: If I was able to change anything in would be 1)able to have access to an ice machine rather than wait for staff to bring ice at the turndown (around 6:00 so scoot out of the room early) 2) the heating came on full force about every 8 minutes and then it was followed by the coldest blast of air - right on my back when I was sleeping. 3) the TV was a bit small and the channel selection was marginal. Picky, picky.
reviews.title: Exceptionally-decorated rooms
Luxury Hoel with great location
reviews.text: We bumped into the next Prime Minister of Canada (B.T.)in the lobby - or at least he thinks he might run. Celebrity spotting in New York.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nicky & Robert England
reviews.title: Superb 1st class hotel

reviews.text: we have just spent our first vacation to the states and had a fantastic time. The hotel Michealangelo was supreb from the minute we checked in,the staff were all very plesant and friendly and the standard of our delux room was 1st class. We will definatly be returning to the Michaelangelo.
reviews.title: What a colossal disappointment

reviews.text: After hearing good things about the hotel, I was excited to stay. But my excitement soon turned to disappointment after I arrived for a recent Wednesday night stay. I was supposedly upgraded to a "nice executive room" that turned out to be on the third floor facing the street. This was an extremely poor location given the 90 minutes of garbage truck ballet that occurred from 11 pm to 1:30 as three dueling trucks honked, revved and compacted loads of neighborhood garbage. I might be willing to forgive the poor location, but the bathroom wasn't as clean it should be (unless the long hairs in the sink were intentionally left there). On top of this, my room service order of Tiramisu arrived so solidly frozen that it took an hour to thaw at room temperature. Finally, adding insult to injury, the staff failed to pick up and shine my shoes, which were left outside my door before 11 pm as directed for the provision of this "complimentary" service. Given the wide assortment of peer hotels with which I have had vastly superior experiences, I would not stay at the Michelangelo again under any circumstances.
reviews.title: The Best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My family and I just got from NYC and had an absolutely great stay at this hotel. Service was excellent, the rooms were big and nicely furnished, and very clean. Last but not least, the location was perfect. I would definitely recommend this hotel in a heartbeat and stay there again and again.
reviews.title: The Michelangelo was AWESOME!

reviews.text: My husband and I have stayed in New York City almost every December (for nine years) to celebrate our birthdays and enjoy the holiday season for a weekend. We have previously stayed at The Palace, which we always enjoyed very much, but this year wanted to try something different to celebrate my husband's 50th birthday. I chose the Michelangelo as a surprise for him... we stayed Dec. 15-17. We were thrilled with our choice!
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, excellent service

likes.disliked: — Heating system was rather loud...we just turned it off.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is excellent, as is housekeeping staff. Would definitely consider hotel for future NYC visit.
reviews.title: Clean, Quiet and a Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found this hotel back in July while looking to book a Christmas getaway in New York this year. What a fabulous find! Great location - just close enough to Times Square/Broadway and 5th Avenue without being on the beaten path. When we checked in we were advised that we had been given an upgraded room. Having stayed in New York hotels, in the past, the room size was superior to those "cracker boxes" you normally receive. I will stay here again and recommend it to anyone heading to New York.
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel!

likes.disliked: — Restaurant not open at this time and breakfast was limited

reviews.text: This was our first experience to New York City and we were excited. I contacted the concierge prior to our trip to arrange airport pickup. He arranged a driver in a sedan (we had 4 people and 11 bags!!!!!!!!!) Needless to say, we paid $118 for a driver, and another $28 for a taxi to accomodate everyone. The front desk, concierge, and bartender were rude and very unpleasent to say the least. Housekeepers and room service delivery were great - very polite and helpful. Luckily, there is plenty to do in New York for Christmas because there is absolutely NOTHING at this hotel. No vending machines, no restaurant, no shops, etc. The room was ok, but not what we expected for the price. We have stayed in much more luxorious hotels in Ft. Lauderdale and a better price. If we return to New York, we will shop for a better hotel next time. Don't be fooled by the pictures on the internet.
reviews.title: not what we expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here from the 5th of december for 6 nights in a junior king suite. It was very spendy because of the time of year. It was our first time in new york and i did alot of research. I was very pleased with my decision. We always stay in 4 and 5 star hotels. The Michelangelo was a very nice place. The room was very nice and consisted of a couch and 2 chairs and then a desk and king bed. The bathroom was very nice and it had a very deep soaking tub which was very nice.
reviews.title: Perfect Location!!!!

reviews.text: Upon arrival they brought us some roses and some chocolates along with a bottle of wine which was very nice. I had requested a quiet room and ours was on the 3rd floor and very quiet and dark which was fine with me. We slept very well because of it..altho i do agree that the heat/cooling fan kicking on and off all night was kind of loud. It did occasionally disturb our sleep. Cant comment on the free breakfast cause it ended every morning at nine and we were never up and ready that early :-) The conceierge was very friendly and helpful too. Housekeeping was wonderful and the rooms were very clean.
reviews.title: At this price, there's much better choices
I love this hotel!!!!!
reviews.text: Excellent!!! The place to stay in NYC. Great service, great location, and a large, lovely room. How can this be in NYC?????

reviews.title: Stay away from the restaurant - Insieme
reviews.text: The restaurant was wildly overpriced for horrible food and service

This is a nice property, with wonderfully large rooms, especially for New York. The bed was comfortable and the staff was very accommodating. The breakfast was simple (coffee and pastry), but tasty. It was good for my business purposes and near to everything that midtown New York has to offer.
reviews.title: Well done property

likes.disliked: — The fact that only breakfast was served.

reviews.text: Stayed here for 3 nights with family. Hotel had no problem honoring our request for adjoining rooms. The Hotel is beautiful and in a perfect mid -town location. Rooms were spotless and beautifully furnished. Loved the late checkout, NY Times delivered to room and nice toiletries in bathroom. Wished they had wi -fi or else free internet in room. Only free internet was near front desk and there was always a wait. Concierge was very accomodating, (thanks James). Very, very nice hotel and look forward to returning.
reviews.title: Loved it!

likes.disliked: — no wifi, expensive daily internet use

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Michelangelo for 5 nights to celebrate New Years Eve. The hotel was perfectly located for all the major tourist attractions - a stones throw from 5th Ave and Times Square. Our room was overlooking 7th Avenue so could see all the hustle and bustle of New Years Eve. The room was very spacious and finished to a high quality - I could not fault it at all. Our stay was everything that i'd hoped it would be - a perfect hotel for everyone. I would not hesitate in recommending this to anyone, you will not be disappointed!!
reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic, will definitely go back!

likes.liked: — It was beautifully decorated, very clean and finished to a high level
likes.disliked: — Staff were a little frosty at times, but as I came to realise this was not uncommon of a lot of NY folk

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from a three night stay at the Michelangelo Hotel in NYC.
reviews.title: New Years Weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At $495/night and a 5 star rating, I wonder who is getting the payofff for such high rankings. Obviously those who are ranking these hotels have less than discerning taste...
reviews.title: Motel 6 style care for only $495/night !! Don't waste your $$$$

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At best a $125/night experience..
reviews.title: fabulous

reviews.text: Small definately European 200 year old style lobby. Entering our 3rd floor, Jr. Suite, the 1st thing I find is that the maid had left dirty cleaning rags on the coffee table in the sitting room. However, being told at check in that they had upgraded me from a Studio to a Jr. suite,( not realizing why at the time) I felt I could let it pass and handed them to the person who brought in the luggage.
reviews.title: Tops in NYC

likes.disliked: — Room not ready upon early arrival

reviews.text: However I soon found that the bedroom came repleate with dirty, grungy 30 year old ( at least ) carpets, brown with age and who knows what else.The bathroom had discusting moldy caulking around the shower and the window overlooking 51st street was also filthy with cracking window caulking and poor insulation. The A/C sounded like an old French 1 HP Citroen automobile that one sees in old B/W movies that for some reasons americans think are artsy. But I guess this was part of the European experience my close to $600/night after taxes was supposed to offer.
reviews.title: The Michelangelo was Fabulous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I went to put a few beverages in the small fridge to find that the Freezer was frozen over and its door was broken and hanging off. Having brought this to the attention of the front desk, they asked if I would mind if the fixed it while I was out, to which I replied - to please do so..
reviews.title: Good for couples

reviews.text: I'm never quite sure about trying a new hotel in the NYC area, but I must say, this was a very pleasant surprise.
reviews.title: Good place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice staff. Great location. Roomy rooms that were clean. You don't always get that in New York no matter what you pay, but in this case, I got it all ... and it didn't break the bank.
reviews.title: It doesnt get much better than this when it comes to luxury and value for money

likes.liked: — The decent sized baths and the tv's in the bathrooms.
likes.disliked: — The electric shocks you recieved every time you pressed for the lift!

reviews.text: I'd definitely return.
reviews.title: I recommend this hotel to all my friends visiting NYC

likes.liked: — The Italian management--They do hoteling the best

reviews.text: I have to agree with all the good things that have already been written about this hotel. The rooms are comfortable, well maintained and have some of the largest bath tubs in NY ( a big plus for a bath lover like myself) . The location is spot on - slap bang between the theatres of Broadway and the shopping of Fifth Avenue. But the best thing is that it is not overpriced like so many of the other five star hotels in NY. The only minus points are that there is no wireless internet and due to the thick carpets, you get an electric shock whenever you touch metal, but these are small things in comparison to some of the five star hotels i have stayed in.
reviews.title: A new home in New York

likes.liked: — The size of the rooms and luxuriousness
likes.disliked: — The location - you walk out the front door and you are in a sea of tourists!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall this is excellent value for money and for that reason i will be sure to return.
reviews.title: Best in Show!
Nice hotel, great location
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at this hotel one night prior to our two week cruise and one night after the conclusion of our cruise. We picked the hotel due to its location (halfway between the airport and the pier) and its website. The price was about the same as the cruiseline was offering for the Holiday Inn Midtown. We thought this hotel looked more interesting and it was. Very pretty lobby that looks just like the photographs on their website.

Our first room was very nice, roomy, painted yellow and white, no view, quiet, and had a dressing/makeup area which was nice. We checked in after 6 p.m. and the room was already turned down. The hotel manager that night made us reservations at a local italian restaurant, Remi's, which was casual and excellent.
reviews.title: Perfect location and large well equipped room
getting a little shabby
reviews.text: On our return trip two weeks later, we were told we were 'upgraded' but the second room (which we paid a higher rate for) was actually smaller in size (both the room and the bathroom) with no dressing area and was right by the elevators which did not turn out to be too noisy. It was painted eggshell with black trim and furnishings. It had multiple shelves of old books which had been bought at a sale. The front desk clerk made us dinner reservations at Ruby Foos which was very good. We also made arrangements to see Mamma Mia at the Winter Garden Theater directly across the street on short notice which was excellent. We never did have turn down service and when we reported it the next day, we were told they looked into it and that we had the DND sign on the door which was not the case. The doorman did hold our luggage until our late flight the following day and we put some things in a lockbox with the front desk. The staff was very friendly and helpful in general.

reviews.title: Luxury Hotel
reviews.text: The free breakfast in the lobby was fine except they charged $6.50 for a small glass of orange juice which seemed ludicrous.

This hotel was a find, perfectly situated for the theatre yet quiet and close to all transportation. The room was the largest and best equipped that I have experienced in NYC. The old world decor of the public areas created a refuge from the city. The light continental breakfast was a nice touch.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A top quality hotel, worth every penny. Large deluxe room, very comfortable bed, excellent power-shower & lots of nice little touches, i.e. fold-down service each night, a couple of chocolates & the next day's weather forecast left on the bedside cabinet.
reviews.title: Superb hotel

likes.disliked: — Stactic shocks from anything metallic (lift buttons, etc)

reviews.title: Absolutely Lovely!
reviews.text: Free pastries / coffee sets you up for the morning, although orange juice is an extra.

reviews.title: Great getaway!
reviews.text: Concierge James Jolis knows everything you'll need to & can organise reservations at the drop of a hat.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, a great place to stay.
reviews.title: We'll be back!

likes.liked: — The rooms was clean, comfortable, and large and the location was great!
likes.disliked: — The continental breakfast offered ends too early.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a one night stay at the Michelangelo. Top notch service, beautifully done interior, comfortable beds and great location. We will defintely return!
reviews.title: Location Can't be Beat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Michelangelo for 5 nights starting May 19 th . This is an exellent Hotel in a great location the staff were always friendly and helpful (use the consignee for info). The room was extremely quiet ! The complimentary breakfast was as expected (muffins, apple & tea/coffee) ,but right out the front door and turn right was a very good deli called Cafe Duke well priced and populur with the locals. The free newspaper in the a.m. at our door was nice ,as was twice a day room cleaning we would recommend a stay at the Michelangelo .
reviews.title: great hotel

likes.disliked: — doormen do not open door except when you arrive the 1st day

reviews.text: My wife and I arrived in NYC earlier than expected. Upon arrival we went to the front desk and after being with a pleasant greeting were informed our room was ready. This was at 1230pm. We were in town to see a 3pm play and found the hotel being ready to freshen up before the show great. The man behind the counter even upgraded us to a suite. The rooms was very clean, staff friendly, and the amenities in the hotel were great. I left my shoes outside the door and the following morning they were shined, at no charge! Our room had a flat
reviews.title: this hotel is great
Very Special
reviews.text: screen tv, seperate sitting area, and a bathroom with the largest bathtub I have ever seen. There was even a TV in the bathroom. Check out was a seemless transaction. Overall we cannot wait to stay at this hotel again.

We stayed in the MichaelAngelo at the end of March 2007 for my partners 40th birthday. It was his first trip to NYC and I wanted it to be very special for him. I not only e mailed the hotel of the reason for our travel but I called them before we left the U.K. to check they had my message. Upon arrival we were upgraded to a junior suite and the whole NY experience began it's magic from that point. The staff were very pleasant, the accommodation was superb and I'm sad to see someone wrote a review saying they'd had a not very good experience, as my partner & I are both rather well travelled and our stay at the MichaelAngelo will remain in our memories for a very long time to come for all the right reasons. The hotel will always be a place I'll rave about and recommend to anyone who will listen but judging by the other reviews, we weren't exceptionally lucky, the guy who gave the 1* rating must have simply been very very unfortunate. I wish he'd had the fantastic memories my partner & I will keep forever. The hotel had a beautiful ambience and incredibly comfortable feel to it..... I'm going to stop going on now, as everytime I think about it, I could go on forever...
reviews.title: The perfect hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a 3 night stay and it couldn't have been better! I booked this hotel for a girls long weekend - 6 of us. The hotel gave us 2 rooms adjoined by a common foyer with 2 king size beds in each room. It was perfect for us. The rooms were large, spotlessly clean, and were beautifully decorated. The beds, pillows and linens were superior - my back pain which has plagued me for months disappeared! We were on the 3rd floor and we heard very little noise from the street, if any. The staff was extremely pleasant and helpful. We had coffee sent up to the room each morning rather than going down for the continental breakfast but we did pick up muffins and pastries as we ran out the door. I had a great cosmopolitan in the piano bar one night but it was a little pricey - $14.00!! The hotel is in the perfect spot for theatre goers and is a short walk to Madison and 5th Avenue, Central Park, and Rockefeller Center. I would defintely recommend this hotel to anyone visting NYC who wants the perfect place to stay!
reviews.title: Loved this Hotel!

aka: The Michelangelo Hotel New York City
description: Be our guest! You will be honored with all the attention and impeccable service you deserve. Experience a place that captures the imagination and attention of the world. So close to NY's Theatre District, Times Square's entertainment and corporate headquarters, proximity to Rockefeller Center--you are in the perfect corner of the city for all you wish to do. With meeting and personal event facilities, plan a perfect event with us.
